page.title: 07ALTYRE AULD KIRK West Forres
page.content: {ALTYRE PARISH CHURCH}was included in the charge of the newley-founded Elgin Cathedral by Bishop Andrew de Moravia in 1293. This shows that the parish already existed and so it is likely that a church was also in existence at this time.In 1657 the parish was joined to that of Rafford and so the church would no longer have been used after this date.This would have been instrumental in preserving such a rare and interesting example of a typical Scottish 13th Century church.It was later used as a burial enclosure.The most interesting stone is that of Robert Cumming.His wife was Lesley Baillie about whom Robert Burns wrote his poem 'Bonnie Lesley'.
